result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob B Hardrath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Designer Drugs (<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(hm)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence Credit of 3 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.  Refund balance to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

Obtain high school diploma/GED/HSED within first year of probation.  Then maintain full-time employment and/or school.  No contact with victim or his family.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-Working hours with Standard Release Conditions-To commence January 21, 2015 by 5:00 p.m.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob B Hardrath

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - rescinded.   Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision
Order on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation 973.09(3)(d) granted by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow 12/16/19.

11:23 AM Defendant Jacob B Hardrath in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agent Katie Lemke appeared from the Department of Corrections/Division of Community Corrections.  
Case called on the Petition for Early Discharge of Probation.  
Agent Lemke makes statements.
State takes no position.
Defendant makes statements. 
For reasons as stated on the record, the court grants the petition for early discharge from probation effective on today's date. 
Defendant may petition the court in one year for expunction.
Review hearing on December 16, 2019 at 10:00 am.

Early Discharge Recommendation filed by DOC

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 11/12/19--Set for hearing.  Agent to appear in person.**

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: revoking defendant's Huber privileges for 60 days
Dated April 15, 2015 filed by the jail requesting the Defendant's huber privileges be revoked for 60 days and reviewed at that time for return to the Huber facility.
Field by the Defendant requesting reinstatement of his Huber privileges.

Defendant Jacob B Hardrath in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Statement made by J.V.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statements by defendant's mother and father.  Statements by defendant.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 3 days if revoked.
- 5 years Probation.
- Cash bail to be applied to costs and surcharge.  Any remaining cash bail to be refunded to poster. 
- Court costs of $268.00; cash bail to be applied.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00; cash bail to be applied.
- Conditions of Probation:  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Obtain high school diploma/GED/HSED within first year of Probation.  Then maintain full-time employment and/or school.  No contact with victim or his family.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
CONDITION TIME: 1 year - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence January 21, 2015 by 5:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Filed by the Department of Corrections requesting an extension of the PSI until January 9, 2015.
Reviewed and approved by the Court, PSI due January 9, 2015.
Sentencing hearing on January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jacob B Hardrath in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Becky Van Dam, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read in.  Court orders Presentence Investigation to be completed and report filed within 60 days.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
